definition: to conspire with sb/to plot/a conspirator/a partner in crime/an accomplice

sentences.english: Oslash; Starscream, Overlord, Scorponok and Onslaught agree to follow Megatron.
sentences.chinese: 紅蜘蛛，霸主，薩克巨人與襲擊同謀共保威震天。

sentences.english: He was accused of being the accessory of those murderers.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控爲那些謀殺者的同謀。

sentences.english: If he was a conspirator, it seemed inconceivable that he would have done so.
sentences.chinese: 如果司機是同謀，那他這麼做似乎不可思議。

sentences.english: He was indicted as being accessory man to the crime.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控爲該罪的同謀者。

sentences.english: He blasted East European critics as 'collaborators with Fascism.
sentences.chinese: 他指責東歐的評論家爲“極端國家主義的同謀”。

sentences.english: Complicity makes them come together and attenuate the rivalry.
sentences.chinese: 同謀使他們走到一齊，減弱比賽。
他必須招出同謀的姓名。

sentences.english: Hard labor for life had been the sentence pronounced against the escaped and contumacious accomplices.
sentences.chinese: 在逃沒有到案的同謀則被判處終身苦役。

sentences.english: The police discovered his conspiracy to overthrow the government with some army officers.
sentences.chinese: 警方發現他與一些軍官同謀企圖推翻政府。

sentences.english: And conspired all of them together to come and to fight against Jerusalem, and to hinder it.
sentences.chinese: 大家同謀要來攻擊耶路撒冷，使城內擾亂。

sentences.english: He engaged his boss as a co-conspirator.
sentences.chinese: 他讓自己的上司成爲了同謀。

sentences.english: Personal complicity and double standards are the nails in the coffin of our ability to lead.
sentences.chinese: 私下同謀和雙重標準是領導力的棺材釘。

sentences.english: The traitor was dispatched by the conspirators.
sentences.chinese: 這名叛徒被同謀者殺死了。

sentences.english: Starscream, Overlord, Scorponok and Onslaught agree to follow Megatron.
sentences.chinese: 紅蜘蛛，領主，薩克巨人與襲擊同謀共保威震天。

sentences.english: In this we found an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 在這件事上，我們找到了一個同謀。

sentences.english: He is the accessory of this crime, so he is also sentences to one year.
sentences.chinese: 他是這起犯罪案的同謀，所以被判有期徒刑一年。

definition: to charge and break through enemy lines
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
